question_paper.question_paper_name: 2022 Oct: IIT M QUIZ 1 DEGREE QPG3
question_paper.question_paper_description: 2022 Oct: IIT M QUIZ 1 DEGREE QPG3

questions.question_text_1: STATE SPACE  In the 8-puzzle, use the combination of tile-number (1 to 8) and the direction (Up, Down,Left, Right) of tile movement to denote a move, for example:  6U — move tile 6 up 2D — move tile 2 down 4L — move tile 4 left 8R — move tile 8 right   Based on the above data, answer the given subquestions.
question_texts: STATE SPACE  In the 8-puzzle, use the combination of tile-number (1 to 8) and the direction (Up, Down,Left, Right) of tile movement to denote a move, for example:  6U — move tile 6 up 2D — move tile 2 down 4L — move tile 4 left 8R — move tile 8 right   Based on the above data, answer the given subquestions.

questions.question_text_1: Starting from board G, the sequence of moves 8D,7R,6U,5U will result in __________ .
questions.question_text_2: Starting from board G, the sequence of moves 8D,7R,6U,5U will result in __________ .
question_texts: Starting from board G, the sequence of moves 8D,7R,6U,5U will result in __________ .
Starting from board G, the sequence of moves 8D,7R,6U,5U will result in __________ .

questions.question_text_1: Starting from board S, what is the shortest sequence of moves that will result in board G?
questions.question_text_2: Starting from board S, what is the shortest sequence of moves that will result in board G?
question_texts: Starting from board S, what is the shortest sequence of moves that will result in board G?
Starting from board S, what is the shortest sequence of moves that will result in board G?

questions.question_text_1: SEARCH  The figure shows a map with several locations on a grid where each tile is 1x1 in size. The locations are at grid points and are connected by either two-way edges (shown as undirected edges) or one-way edges (shown with one arrowhead).  Take S as the start node and G as the goal node. The MoveGen function returns neighbours in alphabetical order. The RemoveSeen procedure removes neighbours already present in OPEN/CLOSED lists.  Use Manhattan distance when needed
questions.question_text_2: SEARCH  The figure shows a map with several locations on a grid where each tile is 1x1 in size. The locations are at grid points and are connected by either two-way edges (shown as undirected edges) or one-way edges (shown with one arrowhead).  Take S as the start node and G as the goal node. The MoveGen function returns neighbours in alphabetical order. The RemoveSeen procedure removes neighbours already present in OPEN/CLOSED lists.  Use Manhattan distance when needed    When we say a node is inspected/expanded/refined it means: the node is picked up from OPEN, and goal test is called, if goal test fails then MoveGen is called and, depending on the algorithm, the neighbours are selectively placed in OPEN.  Based on the above data, answer the given subquestions.

questions.question_text_1: List the first 4 nodes inspected by Depth First Search. List the nodes in the order they were inspected. If the algorithm terminates early then list the nodes inspected up until termination.  Enter a comma separated list of node labels. NO SPACES, TABS, DOTS, BRACKETS, PARENTHESIS OR UNWANTED CHARACTERS. Answer Format: S,X,Y,Z

The locations are at grid points and are connected by either two-way edges (shown as undirected edges) or one-way edges (shown with one arrowhead).  Take S as the start node and G as the goal node. The MoveGen function returns neighbours in alphabetical order. The RemoveSeen procedure removes neighbours already present in OPEN/CLOSED lists.  Use Manhattan distance when needed

SEARCH  The figure shows a map with several locations on a grid where each tile is 1x1 in size. The locations are at grid points and are connected by either two-way edges (shown as undirected edges) or one-way edges (shown with one arrowhead).  Take S as the start node and G as the goal node. The MoveGen function returns neighbours in alphabetical order. The RemoveSeen procedure removes neighbours already present in OPEN/CLOSED lists.  Use Manhattan distance when needed    When we say a node is inspected/expanded/refined it means: the node is picked up from OPEN, and goal test is called, if goal test fails then MoveGen is called and, depending on the algorithm, the neighbours are selectively placed in OPEN.  Based on the above data, answer the given subquestions.
